text: Hello people, we have written a paper about one of our packages that we're going to submit to the Software journal (SAGE). Which pre-print service do you recommend to host a paper about software? I'm putting my papers on arXiv typically, but I feel it doesn't make sense for a software paper...

elements.text: Hello people, we have written a paper about one of our packages that we're going to submit to the Software journal (SAGE). Which pre-print service do you recommend to host a paper about software? I'm putting my papers on arXiv typically, but I feel it doesn't make sense for a software paper...

text:
JORS (journal of open research software) has somewhere in the submission guide a comment saying that it is expected that you put a preprint on arXiv before submission
(I do *not* recommend JORS btw)

elements.text:

(I do

text: Why would you not use arXiv?

elements.text: Why would you not use arXiv?

text: Umm, which section of arXiv would you say makes sense?

elements.text: Umm, which section of arXiv would you say makes sense?

text: It is not _scientific_ work, but a presentation of a new software.

elements.text: work, but a presentation of a new software.

text:
DataDeps.jl is in `Computer Science > Software Engineering`

<https://arxiv.org/abs/1808.01091|https://arxiv.org/abs/1808.01091>

attachments.title: DataDeps.jl: Repeatable Data Setup for Replicable Data Science
attachments.text: We present DataDeps.jl: a julia package for the reproducible handling of static datasets to enhance the repeatability of scripts used in the data and computational sciences. It is used to automate...
attachments.fallback: arXiv.org: DataDeps.jl: Repeatable Data Setup for Replicable Data Science

text:
They are *incredibly* slow to review.
Like over a year.
Several people on this slack have noted this.

elements.text:
slow to review.
Like over a year.

text: They offer no value over JOSS, AFAICT.

elements.text: They offer no value over JOSS, AFAICT.

text: Hey <@U6A936746> and tips on submitting your first Julia package to JOSS? Or rather convincing your advisor it’s a good idea...

elements.text: and tips on submitting your first Julia package to JOSS? Or rather convincing your advisor it’s a good idea...

text:
I *think* all my JOSS papers were submitted without asking my advisor’s permission.
I think I just did it.
I probably told them i was doing it.
I submitted them in like the last month or two of my PhD

More JORS paper was submitted first, and I did talked it them about it; I must have since they are lited as coauithors…
don’t remember what i said.

text: Thank you! I probably have a year left and trying to navigate advisors who are... very hesitant about sharing data or code or publishing outside the usual 2-3 journals

elements.text: Thank you! I probably have a year left and trying to navigate advisors who are... very hesitant about sharing data or code or publishing outside the usual 2-3 journals

text:
I had 3 or 4 software papers in an appendix of my thesis

2 out of my 3 examiners explicitly commented on how good it was that I had them.
